#summary Preview on Production Container

= Introduction =

It means that a gadget-developer can easily deploy (upload) his/her
open-social gadget to a production container (say, iGoogle) from within OSDE, and then he/she can preview the gadget with live interaction with a production container.

= Feature Description =

 * priority: p0=highest, p4=lowest

 # Developer (right-)clicks on anyone of the following and OSDE displays a dropdown list of functions.
   * (done) gadget.xml
   * (p2) "Run" tab
   * (p2) "OSDE" tab
 # Developer selects "Preview on production container" and a list of containers appear.
   * (done) Support iGoogle container
   * (p1) A list of more containers will be supported soon.
 # OSDE pops up a dialog asking for:
   * (done) google account and password
     * if developer has already input account/password info, OSDE stores the corresponding session tokens and does not ask for account/password again during the current session. (p2)
   * (done) checkbox to use external browser
   * (p2) preview home view or canvas view
   * (p3) country and language
 # Devloper clicks on OK button
 # OSDE interacts with iGoogle server to authenticate the user
 # OSDE uploads gadget files to iGoogle server
   * support one gadget xml file (done)
   * (p2) support multiple files
 # OSDE opens a browser and preview the gadget against iGoogle production server.
   * (done) support preview the whole iframe of the gadget
   * (p2) support interaction with the whole iGoogle container (not just inside the iframe of the gadget) during preview.
